events.title: Death of Mary, Queen of Scots
events.description: Mary, Queen of Scots was executed for her involvement in plots to assassinate Queen Elizabeth I of England.
events.significance: Her death marked a significant moment in the Elizabethan era, intensifying the conflict between Scotland and England and influencing the succession of the English throne.

events.title: Alabama admitted to the United States
events.description: Alabama was admitted as the 22nd state of the United States.
events.significance: This expanded the United States territory, intensifying regional conflicts over slavery and state rights ahead of the American Civil War.

events.title: South Pole claimed by Roald Amundsen
events.description: Norwegian explorer Roald Amundsen and his team became the first to reach the South Pole.
events.significance: This achievement marked a major milestone in polar exploration and scientific discovery.

events.title: Venice Canal Bombing during World War II
events.description: Allied forces bombed Venice in an attempt to disrupt German supply lines, causing significant damage including to cultural landmarks.
events.significance: The bombing highlighted the widespread destruction of cultural heritage during wartime and the strategic importance of Venice.

events.title: Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting
events.description: A mass shooting occurred at Sandy Hook Elementary School in Newtown, Connecticut, resulting in the deaths of 26 people, including 20 children.
events.significance: This tragic event led to renewed debates on gun control and school safety in the United States.
